column4: can anyone help me with my ssh server..  please tell me if the configuration is bad.. sshd_conf: http://pastebin.com/d36bc9c2f and ssh_conf: http://pastebin.com/d478bab29
why would not the default work after grabbing with the package manager?
i don't know apparently there's no respond to clients when people want to connect as well as a problem when i want to connect it says access denied after the password sequence
it should work with no configuration.  It is probably an IPtables or other firewall issue
check $ sudo iptables -L (iirc) and see if you are ACCEPT from all ...
http://pastebin.com/m1596638e
I'm no iptables expert but I think that   ... ACCEPT     tcp  --  anywhere             anywhere            tcp dpt:ssh  should mean that you are open to traffic on 22
please ssh if you can on port 443 let's see if it's open
I don't know your ip or anything
but that might yield unexpected behavior as that is the ssl http port usually
Ampelbein, my ip to ssh 41.241.212.226 please..

http://articles.slicehost.com/2008/11/28/ubuntu-intrepid-setup-page-1 that is kind of some of the things I do when setting up a machine.  it is a bit different as they are assuming a slicehost install ... I will try though
nope, I think that it is a firewall issue
also, you might need to restart the sshd server?  if you have made changes to config and have not..
yeas i forwarded fine.. (with windows VNC it works good..)
by all means log into your router and forward the ports though ... hmmm...
i swear to god i did :)
give me a port to forward and i will even print screen for you :P
flush your iptables so that iptables -L gives you three lines that all say accept... use default ssh config (if you can get back there) forward port 22... done ..
then you can go back and learn iptables if you want some custom blockage and use that article to change your ssh port to something else later too
http://pastebin.com/m6f5bdf00 <-- flushed tables.
i see no accept there..
